subject: Ethics
title: Futile Treatment Dilemmas
description: A short lesson to help you apply Futile Treatment Dilemmas.

hook.text: A family demands every treatment for their dying father. The ICU team knows nothing will help. Who decides?

buildup.text: Medical futility means a treatment won't achieve its goalâ€”keeping someone alive isn't the same as helping them.

discovery.text: Doctors sometimes perform procedures they believe are pointless because families insist and laws are unclear.

twist.text: What feels futile to a doctor may feel like hope to a family. 'Futile' is a medical judgment, not a fact.

climax.text: Billions are spent each year on end-of-life care that extends suffering without restoring quality of life.

punchline.text: More treatment isn't more care. Sometimes less is mercy.

quiz.question: What does 'medical futility' mean?
options: A treatment that won't achieve its medical goal, even if it can be performed
A treatment that is too expensive for the hospital to provide
A treatment that the patient refuses
